meanings.definition: To completely destroy or level to the ground.
meanings.sent1: The bulldozer razes the old building to the ground.
meanings.sent2: The wildfire razes the forest, leaving nothing but ashes.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel razes the garden by digging up all the plants.
meanings.sent4: The storm razes the coastline, reshaping it with its powerful waves.
meanings.sent5: The earthquake razes the city, turning buildings into rubble.

meanings.sent1: She razes all the incorrect answers from the whiteboard.
meanings.sent2: The hacker razes all traces of the virus from the computer system.
meanings.sent3: The magic wand razes the mistakes on the paper, leaving it clean.
meanings.sent4: The wind razes footprints in the sand, making them disappear.
meanings.sent5: The eraser razes the pencil marks, making the paper blank again.

meanings.sent1: The carpenter razes the rough edges of the wood to make it smooth.
meanings.sent2: The chef razes the burnt part of the toast before serving it.
meanings.sent3: The gardener razes the weeds from the flower bed, making it neat.
meanings.sent4: The sculptor razes excess clay from the sculpture to refine its shape.
meanings.sent5: The barber razes the hair on the sides, giving a clean look.
